events.name: Social Coding
events.description: A space for women coders to learn from each other, to practice and discuss learnings with fellow peers. This would be a weekly event of informal space to do coding. So bring your pet projects along or join one of our existing teams/ projects to work on. Featured Projects:https://trello.com/b/kl2BTwil/wwc-sg-social-coding-projects First timers, please read:Newbies Step-by-step Guide Please bring your own laptop. Agenda:6:30p - Registration and Introduce projects7:00p - Break out into groups and Start coding! ^_^8:30p - End session There is no food provided, so please make preparations to grab a bite before you turn up. Also, we recommend to bring your own water bottle along. Psst, this event is intended for ladies only. Host:
events.location: #03-04, IDA Labs@NDC 111 Middle Road, National Design Centre, Singapore 188969., IDA Labs@NDC 111 Middle Road, National Design Centre

events.name: Cyber Surveillance & Counter Measures(TSCM) & Threat Actor Hunting
events.description: Agenda • Introduction & Announcement • Cyber Technical Surveillance & Counter Measures (TSCM) – Looking at the physical attacks on IT Infrastructure using covert data taps and transmission devices by Jason Wells. • Threat Actor Hunting by ildaf. (each talk is of 45 mins. including Q&A) Abstract Threat Actor HuntingIn this talk, I will share how I uncovered a member of a cyber hacktivist group reported to be the most notorious in a particular country before the group got disbanded. I will also present what they did which received international attention got me interested in pursuing them and how utilising 'cyber HUMINT' helped me get the information I need to understand the group better. Cyber Technical Surveillance & Counter Measures (TSCM) Traditional Technical Surveillance has changed from large audio and video eavesdropping devices heavily reliant on Radio Frequency to miniaturised devices that use cellular & wifi.  No longer do you need a static listening post nearby but you can access the covert feeds anywhere in world through cheap readily available technology. This talk will look at how the world of technical surveillance has changed, why it uses cellular & wifi, what is a cyber TSCM, gaps in current IT Pen tests and how 5G will accelerate the threat. Bio(s) of Speakers Jason is the CEO of QCC Global (Asia), a company that specialises in Technical Surveillance and Counter Measures (TSCM) and Digital Forensics. His 30 years of experience spans public and private sector from leading the: Global team for Business Risk & Control Management within HSBC Financial Crime & Regulatory Compliance, Corporate Security & Anti Illicit Trade Manager in British American Tobacco in the Middle East, UK military attaché in Damascus, Syria or theHead of Overseas Intelligence team for the British SAS, special forces Having a honours degree in IT, was qualified as a CISSP and holds post graduate diplomas in Security & Risk Management and Anti Money Laundering. Jason has both extensive experience and technical expertise. Ildaf is a cyber threat intelligence analyst whose role includes observing and analysing the threat landscape in Asia Pacific with a deeper focus on South-East Asia. He also has a huge interest in researching and understanding the evolving TTPs of threat actors and their modus operandi.
events.location: JP Morgan, JP Morgan, 168 Robinson Rd, Capital Tower, Singapore 068912

events.name: June Meetup
events.description: Greetings, fellow craftspeople! We're thrilled to have another instalment of API Craft Singapore meetup in June.  Programme 7.00pm: Doors open - mingle over food and drinks 7.20pm: Start of session, opening address by hosts 7.30pm: Start of scheduled talks 9:00pm: Community announcements / End of event  Scheduled Talks • 'Using GraphQL with Django' by Martin • 'Building a data API with GraphQL and Spring' by Frans  Job Opportunities Have a job position you'd like to announce? Contact us from the 'Contact' button on the sidebar, and we'll post it here.  Information for Attendees **Please bring a photo ID to get through building security!** The meetup will be held at DBS Asia X, Sandcrawler Building #07-03 at 1 Fusionopolis View. If you're traveling by MRT, the closest MRT station is CC23 One-North.  Sponsors DBS Core System Technology Department  Community Join our Slack group: http://bit.ly/apicraftsgslack ( http://bit.ly/apicraftsgslack )­
events.location: DBS Asia X (DAX), Sandcrawler Building - 1 Fusionopolis View, #07-03, Singapore 138577
